quack.text: While the editor you see is only presenting the series of blocks making up one chapter, a book is many such chapters, and this is what Quill supports. This is the second chapter in the example document, where various other things that need to be exercised were dumped.
quack.heading: Business this week
quack.text: The American space agency, NASA, reports that they have run out of paperclips.
quack.heading: Leaders
quack.text: The G20 has a legitimacy lacking in other economic clubs, such as the rich country only G7 ... Unfortunately history suggests that big-picture debates on the future of the international monetary system rarely yield results. France should take note. The G20 will remain worth having only if it sticks to the art of the possible.
quack.heading: The virtues of Incompleteness
quack.text: There are several things to take aboard reading this chapter.
quack.list: The user interface is far from complete; terribly sorry about that, but the we've been working on other areas of the project, and so now what the underlying file format supports has far outstripped the capabilities of the Quill editor.

The Parchment File Format is, or should be, stable now, and Parchment will properly render everything in it. So now we have a clear goal to work toward, and we will be building better editor support in the coming months.
quack.text: And that's it. No more list for you.
